Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and accurately depict two different habitats, such as one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can include different types of plants found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or flowering plants for land habitats and aquatic plants for water habitats.
The student can illustrate different types of animals that live in each habitat, like squirrels or lizards in land habitats and fish or clams in water habitats.
The student can compare and contrast the diversity of living things between the two habitats by showing at least two different living things in each habitat.
The student can observe and represent patterns of biodiversity, showing how different plants and animals exist in various habitats.
